content.title: Intro
content.content:
1926
Preceded by

Year
1928
Followed by
1928

Tolkien-related events that took place in 1927.

content.title: February
content.content: ? - J.R.R. Tolkien's "Philology: General Works" is published in The Year's Work in English Studies.

content.title: March
content.content: 12 - J.R.R. Tolkien writes a letter to Ronald Ashton.

content.title: June
content.content: ? - Adventures in Unnatural History and Medieval Metres is published in The Stapeldon Magazine.

content.title: September
content.content:
25 - Producer and interviewer Denys Gueroult is born.
? - J.R.R. Tolkien paints a coiled dragon derived from the poem Beowulf.
? - The Marvellous Land of Snergs is published.

content.title: October
content.content: 22 - James Grout, who would voice Barliman Butterbur in The Lord of the Rings radio series and Nokes in the Smith of Wootton Major episode, is born.

content.title: December
content.content: 21 - Father Christmas writes a letter to J.R.R. Tolkien's children.

? - The Nameless Land, a poem by J.R.R. Tolkien, is published in Realities: An Anthology of Verse
? - Edith Tolkien gives her husband a desk, on which he will write The Hobbit and The Lord of the Rings.
Years
1924 1925 1926 1927 1928 1929 1930
